episodeTitle: Luffy Dies from Exposure?! The Spine-chilling Snow Woman Monet!
episodeTitleJapanese: ルフィ凍死!? 恐怖の雪女モネ!
episodeTitleRomanized: Rufi Tōshi!? Kyōfu no Yuki-On'na Mone!
description: Luffy battles Monet who uses her snow powers to freeze him nearly to death, while Law faces brutal torture from Vergo. Chopper struggles to restrain drug-affected children without harming them.

events.title: Luffy vs Monet Battle Begins
events.description: Monet confronts Luffy in Caesar's lab, creating a ten-layer snow hut barrier (Kamakura Jussoshi) to trap and weaken him with her Yuki Yuki no Mi powers.
events.significance: First major confrontation between Luffy and one of Caesar's executives, showcasing the danger of Logia-type Devil Fruit users.

quotes.text: Ten layers cannot be easily broken!
quotes.speaker: Monet
quotes.context: Monet boasts about her snow hut barrier

quotes.text: You're just stalling for time! I'll just break it in a jiffy!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

events.title: Monet's Freezing Embrace
events.description: Monet hugs Luffy with her snow-covered wings, using her body's extreme coldness to drain his strength and consciousness. Luffy begins to freeze and lose consciousness as snow builds up around them.
events.significance: Demonstrates Monet's lethal combat strategy using her Logia powers, showing how a weaker opponent can still threaten Luffy through tactical advantages.

quotes.text: You can no longer escape my hold. The coldness will sap away your strength.
quotes.speaker: Monet

quotes.text: You cannot beat me, but don't confuse victory with fighting ability.
quotes.speaker: Monet
quotes.context: Monet acknowledges her role is to stall, not defeat Luffy

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Jet Spear Debut
events.description: Nearly frozen to death, Luffy uses Haki to recover his strength and unleashes Gomu Gomu no Jet Spear, a powerful spear-shaped attack that breaks through the floor, creating an opening that leads to the garbage disposal area.
events.significance: Introduction of a new Luffy technique combining his Gear Second speed with his stretching abilities, though it inadvertently causes him to fall into a lower level.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy breaks free from Monet's deadly embrace

events.title: Vergo Brutally Tortures Law
events.description: Vergo confronts Law in the SAD Production room while possessing Law's disembodied heart. He squeezes it repeatedly, causing Law extreme pain, then uses his Haki-hardened fists and bamboo to deliver devastating blows.
events.significance: Reveals the dire situation Law is in and Vergo's ruthless nature and overwhelming power. Shows the vulnerability created by Law's heart being separated from his body.

quotes.speaker: Vergo
quotes.context: Joker's (Doflamingo's) message delivered through Vergo to Law

events.title: Law's Counter Shock
events.description: Despite his injuries and the pain from his heart being squeezed, Law manages to grab Vergo and uses Counter Shock, sending a large electrical surge through Vergo's body. However, the attack does minimal damage due to Vergo's superior Haki.
events.significance: Demonstrates Law's determination and combat abilities, but also highlights the power gap between him and Vergo when Law doesn't have his heart.

events.title: Chopper's Monster Point Struggles
events.description: Chopper transforms into Monster Point to restrain the drug-affected children without harming them. However, he cannot control them effectively without using force, and his Rumble Ball effect wears off, leaving him vulnerable.
events.significance: Shows Chopper's compassion and the dilemma of trying to help the children while they're under Caesar's drug influence.

quotes.text: I can't lay a finger on them! Caesar is trying to make them into big violent fighters!
quotes.speaker: Chopper
quotes.context: Chopper expresses his distress at the children's situation

events.title: Mocha Protects the Candy
events.description: Mocha, having regained her sanity and developed resistance to the NHC10 drug, tries to help Chopper by protecting the dangerous candy from the other children. She runs away with it to prevent them from consuming more of Caesar's addictive substance.
events.significance: Demonstrates Mocha's bravery and the tragic nature of the children's situation. Her resistance to the drug proves that recovery is possible.

quotes.text: Don't eat it! It's evil candy! Chopper is trying to help us. If you don't listen, we won't be able to go home!
quotes.speaker: Mocha
quotes.context: Mocha pleads with the other children

events.title: Smoker Arrives to Confront Vergo
events.description: After Vergo nearly kills Law, Vice-Admiral Smoker arrives at the SAD Production room and prepares to fight his fellow Vice-Admiral Vergo, knowing that Vergo is a traitor working for Doflamingo.
events.significance: Sets up the major confrontation between two Vice-Admirals and former colleagues, highlighting the betrayal and moral conflict.

events.title: Luffy Falls into Garbage Disposal
events.description: After breaking through the floor with his Jet Spear attack, Luffy falls into the facility's garbage disposal system. Monet mocks him, noting that he can only escape by flying.
events.significance: Creates a new obstacle for Luffy and separates him from the immediate conflict, setting up future encounters in the lower levels.

quotes.text: Farewell. You can only escape by flying.
quotes.speaker: Monet
quotes.context: Monet bids farewell to the fallen Luffy

events.title: Momonosuke Mentioned in Silhouette
events.description: A girl mentions seeing a child who turned into a dragon in the Secret Room, expressing worry for someone named Momonosuke. This marks Momonosuke's first mention in the anime.
events.significance: First reference to Momonosuke, foreshadowing his importance to the arc and his connection to the artificial Devil Fruit experiments.

quotes.text: I peeked into the Secret Room and kept it to myself. I'm worried for Momonosuke!
quotes.speaker: Girl
quotes.context: A child reveals information about the dragon transformation

events.title: Monet's Kamakura Jussoshi Technique
events.description: Monet demonstrates her Kamakura Jussoshi (Ten-Layered Snow Hut) technique, creating multiple layers of solid snow barriers that she can pass through freely as a Logia user while trapping her opponents.
events.significance: Showcases Monet's strategic use of her Yuki Yuki no Mi Devil Fruit powers and her tactical approach to combat.

events.title: Vergo's Full-Body Haki Display
events.description: Vergo demonstrates his advanced Busoshoku Haki by hardening his entire arm and bamboo stick, delivering devastating blows to Law that showcase his mastery of Armament Haki.
events.significance: Establishes Vergo as one of the most proficient Haki users shown at this point in the series, capable of hardening his entire body.

quotes.text: You cannot beat me, but don't confuse victory with fighting ability.
quotes.speaker: Monet
quotes.context: Monet explains her tactical role to Luffy

quotes.speaker: Vergo
quotes.context: Delivering Doflamingo's message to the tortured Law

quotes.text: Don't eat it! It's evil candy! If you don't listen, we won't be able to go home!
quotes.speaker: Mocha
quotes.context: Mocha pleads with the drug-affected children

themes.description: Multiple characters put themselves at risk to protect others: Chopper refuses to harm the children despite them attacking him, Mocha risks herself to keep the candy away from the other children, and Law continues fighting despite being tortured.
themes.symbolism: The children's addiction to the candy represents how innocent people can be corrupted and exploited, requiring heroes to make difficult choices to save them.

themes.description: The episode emphasizes that raw power isn't everything. Monet openly admits she can't defeat Luffy but can still threaten him through tactics. Vergo's advantage comes from possessing Law's heart rather than pure combat superiority.
themes.symbolism: The separated heart represents vulnerability and how even the strongest can be brought low through strategic disadvantages.

themes.description: Vergo's betrayal of the Marines is highlighted as Smoker prepares to confront his former colleague. The theme of institutional corruption and hidden loyalties runs throughout.
themes.symbolism: Vergo's bamboo stick with food on it symbolizes his casual cruelty and how he hides his true nature behind mundane quirks.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy faces a genuine threat from Monet's strategic approach, showing that even powerful fighters can be endangered by environmental and tactical disadvantages.
keyActions: Nearly freezes to death in Monet's embrace
Uses Haki to recover and unleashes Jet Spear
Falls through the floor into garbage disposal
quotes: You're just stalling for time! I'll just break it in a jiffy!

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates tactical intelligence by acknowledging her role is to delay rather than defeat Luffy. Shows the effectiveness of using environmental advantages.
keyActions: Uses freezing embrace to nearly kill Luffy
Successfully delays Luffy despite not defeating him
quotes: You cannot beat me, but don't confuse victory with fighting ability.
You can no longer escape my hold. The coldness will sap away your strength.

characterSpotlights.development: Law's vulnerability is on full display as he's brutally tortured while separated from his heart, yet he still fights back with Counter Shock.
Chopper's medical ethics and compassion are highlighted as he refuses to harm the children even when they attack him.
keyActions: Uses Monster Point to restrain children non-violently
Transformation wears off, leaving him vulnerable
Expresses distress about the children's plight
quotes: I can't lay a finger on them! Caesar is trying to make them into big violent fighters!

characterSpotlights.development: Mocha emerges as a hero among the children, having overcome the drug's effects and now trying to save the others.
keyActions: Shows resistance to the NHC10 drug
Protects the candy from other children
Pleads with children to resist the addiction
quotes: Don't eat it! It's evil candy! Chopper is trying to help us. If you don't listen, we won't be able to go home!

mangaDifferences.difference: In the anime, Chopper is not trampled by the children after returning to his normal form, as shown in the manga.
The anime extends the Luffy vs Monet fight scenes with additional animation showing Luffy struggling in the cold.

trivia.fact: Episode 609 aired on August 25, 2013 in Japan and achieved a 6.2% TV rating, ranking 7th for the week.
This episode marks the first mention of Momonosuke in the anime, though only in silhouette/flashback form. His full appearance comes in Episode 611.
The episode was directed by Aya Komaki with screenplay by Tomohiro Nakayama, and adapted from Chapter 683 of the manga.
This episode aired on Toonami in the US on March 26, 2023, nearly 10 years after its original Japanese broadcast.

sources.title: One Piece Ep 609 Preview - JCR Comic Arts

trivia.fact: Naoko Matsui, Monet's Japanese voice actress, is known for her roles in various anime including Candy Candy and bringing a haunting quality to Monet's character.
The DVD release for this episode came out on November 10, 2020, as part of the Punk Hazard arc compilation.
